author: barnabasbusa
content: I think the biggest hurdle to comply with this new format would be <@&652918665943056397> by far.

author: __flcl
content: It's real to do. We planned to add it sooner or later. There is also yaml approach WIP. And I'm also thinking if we just go with this specific json schema we still can extend it with a complementary json file that defines what this or that fork means in terms of activated eips and settings

author: barnabasbusa
content: I think if you would want to have complimentary json file for activated EIPs it should be proposed to 7949, and we can discuss if its something most clients would want to do.

author: __flcl
content:
> doable by Glammy?
Very likely yes. 
>  complementary json file 
something like that in yaml: https://github.com/flcl42/genesis/blob/main/default.yml is base for any specs including mainnet https://github.com/flcl42/genesis/blob/main/ethereum.yaml
